page.title: 01PENWORTHAM A PRESTON SUBURB
page.content: PENWORTHAM though mentioned in the original Domesday Book,is now regarded s a suburb of Preston.It is divided from Preston by the River Ribble and crossing the river is a major problem for commutors.A new bridge across the iver has been a most welcome development of the 1980's.There is now alot less traffic congeston at peak imes of the day.The area includes the site of an old Priory,after which the local County Comprehensive is named.There is also an old Endowed Grammer School at Hutton,one mile from Penwortham.The headquarters for Lancashire Police is also in the area.This has an accident centre for the North West.Penwortham is a pleasant mixture of modern houses and farmland.It has an interesting history and hopefully a prosperous future.
